transcript.text: Well, hello! Happy new year!
even if it has been several days since new year.
I hope you're all doing well,
myself I'm... *coughing*
I was getting to it, I'm extremely sick,
I confess, I wanted to shot the end of "Getting over it"
and I believe the disease comes on time
because I would simply have a nervous breakdown.
On June 25th, I shot a video about my last 365 days on YouTube
and today I wanted to do the same
because first of all, I am unable to do anything else,
and then, because at the moment I shot this video,
I couldn't doubt that what was coming next will be crazier.
These 6 last months on YouTube
have been unbelievable
in terms of encounters or personal development.
On July 1st, I released on my YouTube channel the music video of "Product placements"
With Maxenss, who became a really good friend of mine.
I actually aquired a lot of experience from the video "Overwatch Rap Battle"
with PV Nova, Julfou or Nodey.
It is the most viewed video in France in 2017 by the way, so thanks a lot,
and it made everyone who worked on this project happy, so thank you.
After that, I had acquired enough knowledge to make a music myself,
but I didn't want to do it alone, I wanted it to be a thing between friends,
so I asked Maxenss, who was very excited about the theme and the mood of the song,
so we did that and it was awesome!
Two weeks later I asked BigFlo & Oli who really wanted to do something together for the release of their album,
to tell them about an idea that I had which was to pick random words in a dictionary and find a way to use them in rap verses.
It's worth mentioning that they're guys who know very well the "YouTube Game" and are really nice,
and already wanted to do something with me in 2015,
so I invited them at the end of a video to do a little rap...
(2015 Squeezie) There you go guys, it's already the end of the video I hope you enjoyed it and if...
Yo we're BigFlo & Oli, the album is there,
we aimed high, we come by Squeezie's, we throw a mess in your video,
like Lucas (Squeezie) we can fail our intros, pretend to be handsome in front of the PC, starve like Jumbo (Squeezie's cat)
I know, we were young, I won't lie; when you watch this now it's kind of cringy...
But anyway it was nice to meet them and we really enjoyed it,
and we told each other that when their upcoming album is released, we'll do something cool.

Done, we had released this video in which we had fun about the tag on
Alain Rey's dictionary,
and it really worked, you really liked the concept.
You know what's next, 2 months later, I tell them: ''Guys, the thing we did 2 months ago was amazing, I want to do the same for the better".
but at the same time, I had already contacted "Le Petit Robert", the editor of the dictionary that we used in the first video,
and asked them it there was a way to bring Alain Rey for a video,
but I think he was off for a vacation in Brittany at that moment,
so I didn't really get an answer .
In fact, Bigflo & Oli had the same idea to bring Alain Rey,
and had asked me: "Dude, don't you think you can bring Alain Rey here?"
I did everything so they didn't find out,
I even had them believe that Alain Rey took badly
the fact that we made fun of the tag with his face on it,
which was false!
About 7 days later, I got an answer from the editor
who told me: "Well, Alain is really excited about this,
he loved your video and what you did,
he thinks it's an amazing concept.
Then, I introduce them to the so-called Alain Rey,
they were, well you saw in the video "Best of 2017" released a few days ago,
they were completely taken by surprise,
they were so happy.
Alain Rey is adorable,
he is so understanding, attentive,
funny, and a great gentleman.
Honestly, it felt a bit like he was our grandfather,
who came to see us,
and we had a kind of natural respect for him,
and he is so charismatic, it was really amazing.
Next evening, we release the music video
that we made in an hour, real quick
we only did 3 takes for every shot.
People really liked it,
today it is also one the most viewed videos
of my channel, 19 millions of views,
I think it's the second most viewed after "Overwatch Rap Battle",
so it's insane!
These last 6 months on YouTube
are also the ones during which I made the most videos with other people;
McFly and Carlito,
Natoo,
Maxenss,
Cyprien...
I really shot many videos with other people,
because I remembered that back when I began doing videos on YouTube,
it was really based on this.
I was trying to do things with friends from high school,
to have them in videos,
have fun together.
I actually had lost this thing for 2 years;
I isolated myself,
I used to work like a dog
and release 4 videos a week,
I completely forgot
why I was doing videos on YouTube,
why I began doing it.
So these last 3 months were liberating,
it really made me feel better
to shot videos with many people.
The best thing is to invite friends for a video,
to have fun with them,
because there's complicity,
there's something, and people love that,
watching people who like each other
having fun together,
make fun of one another, and everything.
Even I really had fun
making lots of videos with McFly and Carlito,
they truly were my best encounter in 2017.
They are 2 wonderful people, I love them,
and they brought a lot to me.
They're a bit like my big brothers!
I don't know,
it sort of triggered me.
We often deprive ourselves of certain things
because we're afraid,
because we don't have the courage,
because we're in our comfort zone.
At a moment, I think one should have fun,
have the courage to do what they really want to accomplish,
and figure the reactions out after,
not worry too much about them.
So at the same time as doing videos
with lots of people,
I also... Something happened this year,
and came out as being the biggest thing that happened for years for me on YouTube.
I finally stopped trying to release
a certain number of videos a week,
to force myself doing them.
I think most of the YouTubers
who make a lot of videos a week
have actually the same issue.
They are afraid to make less,
and it can be really dangerous to carry that way.
I personally did that for 2 or 3 years.
It really isolates you
because you're in front of your PC all day,
trying to figure out what to do,
doing it, editing it, uploading it,
and this happens 4 times a week!
Yes, I agree, there are worse conditons
but I think that we YouTubers have everything to be happy
and it's too bad spoiling the joy
by forcing oneself to do things like that,
plus, no one forces us to do it, it's really stupid!
As a consequence, I have more fun shooting videos,
I want to do it more ,
but something happens for the editing as well:
there are less videos to edit
so when you edit one, you have more time for it,
but the most important is that your life gets more fulfilled
because you work a bit less
so you allow yourself to have more fun with the editing.
I don't know whether you knew it,
but I don't edit the videos myself,
well I edit some but not all of them at all.
Most of them are edited by Clement,
my video editor for 2 years now.
There is a real creation work
behind all the videos, one really need to add their "touch"
to the editing, otherwise the video won't be too good.
Clement really works on it,
he really works like a dog,
and damn, the videos are amazing!
Clement, if you're watching this,
and I know you'll be editing this one *laughs*
I know you're watching it!
Well love and kisses to you!
Talking about Clement,
I was really happy because
I went to Canada in August
for an OP organized by Canada Tourist Office
* in a Quebec accent* Destination Canada
This accent really sucks.
It really made me feel good for several reasons:
first, I went there with Clement
and we never actually spent a lot of time together
I am really a homebody who enjoys being alone,
and so is Clement,
so we're never really together
like meeting every evening...
That trip really had us live together
for 7 days
in an intense way.
We did very cool stuff together,
even if we were working,
it was really fulfilling,
it made us closer,
so I think it was a good thing.
Then, apart from that
I got to meet my fans
from Canada!
Whom we don't see enough in France
because they're in Canada!
There was this scene in the second vlog
in which I go to a carnival
in a really small town of Quebec,
really tiny,
And there were a lot of people who recognized me,
they all were so cool, surprised to see me there,
I was also surprised to see so many Quebeckers fans
I truly keep
a great memory of this evening
apart from the goddamn mosquito bites
we went through with Clement
on the Big Wheel at the end.
Terrible man! There were a thousand moquitos
in every floor of the wheel,
it was horrible!
Quebeckers really warmed my heart, anyway.
I discovered your traditions,
your favorite dishes,
your way and joy of living...
I truly thank all the people I met there
whoever they were: subscribers,
people who helped us through the trip...
It was insane!
I keep a memory for ever on my skin
thanks to David Coste who tattoed me, and Clement too by the way!
All the trips I was able to go on
really touched me, and I will remember them forever,
and the last one I went on
was amazing!
Because it was in Japan, which is my favorite country on Earth,
and also because I finally adopted a little Shiba Inu!
I've been dreaming for this thing for so long,
and like I said,
I really passed 2 years focused only on working,
shooting, editing, all the time, 4 times a week,
I really had no time, even to take care of Jumbo,
I had little time, it was hell.
So I postponed this project
which was adopting a dog,
because I just wasn't ready,
and this kind of decision needs to be taken seriously
and not lightly.
I go to Japan a first time,
I see him, so tiny,
he was so happy to see me
although he didn't even know me!
I still don't understand!
If I see a stranger coming to me,
man I don't give a damn!
He got so crazy about me being there,
I go outside, he runs, he comes into my arms
it was crazy.
I'm so unreasonable about him,
and sometimes I'm afraid,
I'm like: "Wait, maybe I overdo things with my dog".
But that's how it is when we love someone
or an animal,
well, we want to
show it,
and not hide ourselves!
In terms of human experiences,
we also went to sleep in a forest
with Mamytwink in the nature!
We had this idea several months ago
when we visited an abandoned hospital
We told each other: "Dude, wouldn't it be amazing to spend a night in a forest,
we'll definitely shit ourselves!"
Well at the end we really didn't,
because there was François with us, who has a lot of experience and is really good!
If a bear shows up, François doesn't give a damn!
He gives it an armlock, no problems anymore!
François, you are my hero.
It's kind of funny because I used to watch Mamytwink's shows
many years ago,
he used to stream on jeuxvideo.com
and talked about World of Warcraft,
and telling myself that years later,
I end up with that guy
in a forest, building a fire,
and making a shelter,
I think it's awesome!
Mamytwink,
kisses to you.
November!
I release my first book "Tourne la page" (Turn the page),
made with Maxenss and my brother.
It makes me happy to make something
that people will be happy to buy
because it is linked to you,
you're the one who made it,
and they will feel like they have a piece of you with them.
I didn't want them to have this impression
with a worthless object that I didn't even make myself.
It is a book we made ourselves,
so we may like it or not,
it's natural, it can please everyone,
but at least, I'm proud of it
and there's nothing better than being satisfied with what you've created
and to make people happy
with it!
"Voilà"
These last 6 months, I also got on TV!
*voice over* "Turn the page", were you afraid that your fans
didn't know how a book works?
So, in 2017, watching video games became a job..
Yeah, but you need to know...
... and to earn money doing it!
We met many lazy people but this one is phenomenal!
Damn it...
It still hurts so much...
Even months later...
It's false!
I can't shot this video without talking about this,
even if I'd have liked not to,
because it's not worth it.
I needed to promote my book,
and to do so I had to get on TV.
So we chose (Thierry) Ardisson (a french TV personality)
This "but you're paid to play video games" thing
had already been used by other french TV channels (Canal +)
with (Antoine) De Caunes (a french TV and radio host),
1 or 2 years before that.
It already went viral.
To be honest with you,
at that moment, I didn't take it badly,
because it's TV!
You know what happens when a YouTuber gets on TV,
it's always the same!
This matter with Ardisson is pretty funny
because people greatly reacted to it.
But I think that reacting
in an angry way like this
makes them right, you know, TV people told themselves:
Well that's what we thought,
YouTube really is a kid thing,
and as soon as we criticize a bit,
they go crazy just like 12-year-old children."
I think that the best thing to do
would've been to show Ardisson that wanting to create a "buzz"
by dissing YouTubers
doesn't work!
Unfortunately, it happened the other way around,
it worked well for him,
everyone talked about it,
so he completely won,
he managed to get what he wanted,
which is go viral thanks to a guest.
Even if it wasn't a pleasant time,
I ain't going to lie!
I don't care, people know what I'm worth,
I know what I'm worth.
That's why on the set, I really didn't take
everything he said to me badly.
Anyway, I thank you all for your many messages of support,
it really was heart warming,
even though I wasn't doing bad,
I didn't care at all after this show.
I thought it was really cute for everyone to send me messages,
but on the other hand I was like: "Shit, people think I'm not doing well"
while it was the opposite!
I couldn't care less about what happened on that TV set.
My thing is the Internet,
and if something like happened on my YouTube channel,
then I'd be pissed off.
But on TV...
I don't care.
Some people thought that my video "Self-mockery freestyle"
was in response to Ardisson,
but not at all,
it was planned and written way before I got on Ardisson's show.
The whole video wasn't based
on the fact that I was mocked on Ardisson's show.
Well my friends, that was my last 6 months on YouTube,
they were intense, crazy,
there were big changes in my life.
I just thank you all because I have the best damn job in the world.
For me, the most important is to stay true to you
and to myself,
and to not trap myself in one thing,
to not lie to myself,
not force myself to do something I don't really want to do
but I'm afraid of people's reactions so I do it.
These last 6 months made me feel liberated
I really feel good,
I have way more time for myself,
for my dog,
for my friends, my family.
I hope that my videos in 2018 will be even better,
that there will be more crazy projects,
that you'll like it even more,
and that on your side, it'll be the same,
that your projects will come into fluition,
that you'll do everything to do so,
and I wish you happiness, many good things,
making this video and talking to you
makes me feel really good, I needed it very much.
I'm not a life model but I just give you my point of view
on these last 6 months,
on my personal experience concerning YouTube,
concerning you,
and here we are.
See you soon for another video,
happy new year again,
I wish you the best, I send lots of kisses to you and your relatives
and to everyone.
I'm going to wrap myself in my blanket
to get a bit of...
Ah, that illness...
Thank you again and see you soon for crazier videos.
Ah I've got those body aches man,
I feel like I'm 80.
